Shares of data management firm Acxiom Corp. acxm are down 20% in Thursday trading after Facebook Inc. FB, -1.58% announced its plans to discontinue Facebook Partner Categories, an audience-targeting platform.
Acxiom said in a filing late Wednesday that it didn't expect the changes to affect its 2018 guidance, but it predicted that 2019 revenue and profitability could fall by up to $25 million.
Facebook's move came amid calls for the social network to change its data-privacy practices in the wake of the Cambridge Analytica scandal.
Facebook shares are up 5.4% in Thursday trading and up 13% over the past 12 months, while the S&P 500 SPX, -2.33% has gained 12%.
Facebook Partner Categories leveraged third-party data companies, including Acxiom.
